article_text:
Here’s what caught our eyes this week.

Mother Jones created a punchy graphic of where the water in California goes. To growing almonds, yes, as we’ve heard numerous times. But beef and milk production need huge quantities, too, it says.

Photo

Sometimes it seems that everyone making a map tries to evoke the classic one of the New York subway system, like this one of historical train routes in the Bay Area. But we do pause to marvel at the simplicity and the imposition of order, like this map of Amtrak routes.

Brookings explains why American companies don’t, but should, run apprenticeships.

The methodology used by a French economics student and blogger to map the universe of influential economics bloggers on Twitter is actually more interesting than the result. We detected an Upshot trapezoid in there.

This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshot’s weekly newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

twitter.title: Stuff We Liked
